main event: A UFO was observed over Tulsa, Oklahoma on 19 September 1957, with an estimated size of 60 feet in diameter and speed of 23,000 miles per hour.
interesting points: The object was reported to have disappeared in the center of the airplane., The sighting was made at 1700 CST by a civilian., The report was filed about 3 weeks after the sighting occurred., The radar indicated the object was likely moving from North to South., Comments suggested that it might have been a radar malfunction.
witness description: Mr. of Oklahoma, age 30, observed a bright silver object traveling at an estimated speed over 1,000 mph.
